revised_title: Isochores and Recombination in Mammalian Genome Evolution
tldr: The author investigates the relationship between recombination frequency and sequence G+C content in mammals, finding a positive correlation between the two. This correlation provides an explanation for why gene density is higher in G+C rich isochores and why long interspersed elements are exclusive to G+C poor isochores. The author also discusses the role of recombination in mammalian genome evolution and the mechanisms behind it.
